member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.RenderTree.ArrayBuilder`1
member.summary:
Implements a list that uses an array of objects to store the elements.
This differs from a in that it not only grows as required but also shrinks if cleared with significant excess capacity. This makes it useful for component rendering, because components can be long-lived and re-render frequently, with the rendered size varying dramatically depending on the user's navigation in the app.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.RenderTree.RenderTreeFrame.ComponentReferenceCaptureParentFrameIndex
member.summary: If the property equals , gets the index of the parent frame representing the component being captured. Otherwise, the value is undefined. WARNING: This index can only be used in the context of the frame's original render tree. If the frame is copied elsewhere, such as to the ReferenceFrames buffer of a RenderTreeDiff, then the index will not relate to entries in that other buffer. Currently there's no scenario where this matters, but if there was, we could change all of the subtree initialization logic in RenderTreeDiffBuilder to walk the frames hierarchically, then it would know the parent index at the point where it wants to initialize the ComponentReferenceCapture frame.

member.summary: The kind of drag data item, string or file

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIDataTransferItem.Type

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIKeyboardEventArgs
member.summary: Supplies information about a keyboard event that is being raised.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIKeyboardEventArgs.Key
member.summary: The key value of the key represented by the event. If the value has a printed representation, this attribute's value is the same as the char attribute. Otherwise, it's one of the key value strings specified in 'Key values'. If the key can't be identified, this is the string "Unidentified"

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIKeyboardEventArgs.Code
member.summary: Holds a string that identifies the physical key being pressed. The value is not affected by the current keyboard layout or modifier state, so a particular key will always return the same value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIKeyboardEventArgs.Location
member.summary: The location of the key on the device.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIKeyboardEventArgs.Repeat
member.summary: true if a key has been depressed long enough to trigger key repetition, otherwise false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIKeyboardEventArgs.CtrlKey
member.summary: true if the control key was down when the event was fired. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIKeyboardEventArgs.ShiftKey
member.summary: true if the shift key was down when the event was fired. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIKeyboardEventArgs.AltKey
member.summary: true if the alt key was down when the event was fired. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIKeyboardEventArgs.MetaKey
member.summary: true if the meta key was down when the event was fired. false otherwise.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIMouseEventArgs
member.summary: Supplies information about a mouse event that is being raised.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIMouseEventArgs.Detail
member.summary: A count of consecutive clicks that happened in a short amount of time, incremented by one.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIMouseEventArgs.ScreenX
member.summary: The X coordinate of the mouse pointer in global (screen) coordinates.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIMouseEventArgs.ScreenY
member.summary: The Y coordinate of the mouse pointer in global (screen) coordinates.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIMouseEventArgs.ClientX
member.summary: The X coordinate of the mouse pointer in local (DOM content) coordinates.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIMouseEventArgs.ClientY
member.summary: The Y coordinate of the mouse pointer in local (DOM content) coordinates.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIMouseEventArgs.Button
member.summary: The button number that was pressed when the mouse event was fired: Left button=0, middle button=1 (if present), right button=2. For mice configured for left handed use in which the button actions are reversed the values are instead read from right to left.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIMouseEventArgs.Buttons
member.summary: The buttons being pressed when the mouse event was fired: Left button=1, Right button=2, Middle (wheel) button=4, 4th button (typically, "Browser Back" button)=8, 5th button (typically, "Browser Forward" button)=16. If two or more buttons are pressed, returns the logical sum of the values. E.g., if Left button and Right button are pressed, returns 3 (=1 | 2).

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIMouseEventArgs.CtrlKey
member.summary: true if the control key was down when the event was fired. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIMouseEventArgs.ShiftKey
member.summary: true if the shift key was down when the event was fired. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIMouseEventArgs.AltKey
member.summary: true if the alt key was down when the event was fired. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIMouseEventArgs.MetaKey
member.summary: true if the meta key was down when the event was fired. false otherwise.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIPointerEventArgs
member.summary: Supplies information about a mouse event that is being raised.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIPointerEventArgs.PointerId
member.summary: A unique identifier for the pointer causing the event.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIPointerEventArgs.Width
member.summary: The width (magnitude on the X axis), in CSS pixels, of the contact geometry of the pointer.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIPointerEventArgs.Height
member.summary: The height (magnitude on the Y axis), in CSS pixels, of the contact geometry of the pointer.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIPointerEventArgs.Pressure
member.summary: The normalized pressure of the pointer input in the range of 0 to 1, where 0 and 1 represent the minimum and maximum pressure the hardware is capable of detecting, respectively.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIPointerEventArgs.TiltX
member.summary: The plane angle (in degrees, in the range of -90 to 90) between the Y-Z plane and the plane containing both the transducer (e.g. pen stylus) axis and the Y axis.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIPointerEventArgs.TiltY
member.summary: The plane angle (in degrees, in the range of -90 to 90) between the X-Z plane and the plane containing both the transducer (e.g. pen stylus) axis and the X axis.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIPointerEventArgs.PointerType
member.summary: Indicates the device type that caused the event. Must be one of the strings mouse, pen or touch, or an empty string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIPointerEventArgs.IsPrimary
member.summary: Indicates if the pointer represents the primary pointer of this pointer type.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIProgressEventArgs
member.summary: Supplies information about a progress event that is being raised.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIProgressEventArgs.LengthComputable
member.summary: Whether or not the total size of the transfer is known.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIProgressEventArgs.Loaded
member.summary: The number of bytes transferred since the beginning of the operation. This doesn't include headers and other overhead, but only the content itself.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIProgressEventArgs.Total
member.summary: The total number of bytes of content that will be transferred during the operation. If the total size is unknown, this value is zero.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UITouchEventArgs
member.summary: Supplies information about a touch event that is being raised.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UITouchEventArgs.Detail
member.summary: A count of consecutive clicks that happened in a short amount of time, incremented by one.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UITouchEventArgs.Touches
member.summary: A list of for every point of contact currently touching the surface.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UITouchEventArgs.TargetTouches
member.summary: A list of for every point of contact that is touching the surface and started on the element that is the target of the current event.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UITouchEventArgs.ChangedTouches
member.summary: A list of Touches for every point of contact which contributed to the event. For the touchstart event this must be a list of the touch points that just became active with the current event. For the touchmove event this must be a list of the touch points that have moved since the last event. For the touchend and touchcancel events this must be a list of the touch points that have just been removed from the surface.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UITouchEventArgs.CtrlKey
member.summary: true if the control key was down when the event was fired. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UITouchEventArgs.ShiftKey
member.summary: true if the shift key was down when the event was fired. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UITouchEventArgs.AltKey
member.summary: true if the alt key was down when the event was fired. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UITouchEventArgs.MetaKey
member.summary: true if the meta key was down when the event was fired. false otherwise.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UITouchPoint
member.summary: Represents a single contact point on a touch-sensitive device. The contact point is commonly a finger or stylus and the device may be a touchscreen or trackpad.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UITouchPoint.Identifier
member.summary: A unique identifier for this Touch object. A given touch point (say, by a finger) will have the same identifier for the duration of its movement around the surface. This lets you ensure that you're tracking the same touch all the time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UITouchPoint.ScreenX
member.summary: The X coordinate of the touch point relative to the left edge of the screen.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UITouchPoint.ScreenY
member.summary: The Y coordinate of the touch point relative to the top edge of the screen.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UITouchPoint.ClientX
member.summary: The X coordinate of the touch point relative to the left edge of the browser viewport, not including any scroll offset.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UITouchPoint.ClientY
member.summary: The Y coordinate of the touch point relative to the top edge of the browser viewport, not including any scroll offset.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UITouchPoint.PageX
member.summary: The X coordinate of the touch point relative to the left edge of the document. Unlike , this value includes the horizontal scroll offset, if any.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UITouchPoint.PageY
member.summary: The Y coordinate of the touch point relative to the top of the document. Unlike , this value includes the vertical scroll offset, if any.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIWheelEventArgs
member.summary: Supplies information about a mouse wheel event that is being raised.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIWheelEventArgs.DeltaX
member.summary: The horizontal scroll amount.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIWheelEventArgs.DeltaY
member.summary: The vertical scroll amount.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIWheelEventArgs.DeltaZ
member.summary: The scroll amount for the z-axis.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIWheelEventArgs.DeltaMode
member.summary: The unit of the delta values scroll amount.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIEventArgsRenderTreeBuilderExtensions
member.summary: Extensions methods on for event handlers.

remarks.para: These methods enable method-group to delegate conversion for delegates and methods that accept types derived from .

When a component is authored in Razor (.cshtml), the Razor code generator will maintain a mapping between event names and event arg types that can be used to generate more strongly typed code. Generated code for the same case will look like:
builder.AddAttribute(0, "onkeypress", BindMethods.GetEventHandlerValue<UIKeyboardEventArgs>(MyKeyPressHandler));

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIEventArgsRenderTreeBuilderExtensions.AddAttribute(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.RenderTree.RenderTreeBuilder,System.Int32,System.String,System.Action{Microsoft.AspNetCore.Blazor.UIChangeEventArgs})

summary.para: Appends a frame representing an -valued attribute.
The attribute is associated with the most recently added element. If the value is null and the current element is not a component, the frame will be omitted.

member.param: An integer that represents the position of the instruction in the source code.
